author: Cammy Brothers
title: ‘Renaissance Woman’ Review: A Lady of Letters
text:
If the world outside of Italian Renaissance literature knows the name Vittoria Colonna at all, it is as a footnote to Michelangelo. She was his friend and correspondent, with whom he exchanged poems, drawings and letters. But more than that, she was an accomplished poet, a friend to many of Europe’s leading religious reformers and, perhaps most remarkably for a 16th-century woman, the architect of her own destiny.
A child of one of the richest and most powerful families in Rome, Colonna was married into a union of political...
